title: Why do kids have to go to school if they don't like school? - Quora

response.answer_text: Because they have to deal with our FEAR-BASED educational system. Here a sample of the torture millions of kids experience each day: Every student is expected to meet a defined “standard.” Like machines!The grading system is a top-down grading system. Like a machine, you’re expected to perform at peak performance.Such 100% performance was somehow, someday, someplace, determined possibly 100 years ago by some disrupted Industrial Age “test-god.”This grading system kills all natural talents of the kids. What this system is teaching them is to comply and submit themselves to the determined “standard.”Like a machine; performance is pre-established and must be met.Anything under the pre-established standards you are considered an “UNDER PERFORMER.”This is a depressing push-down torture!The current system KILLS ALL CREATIVITY and diversity of thought.The standards are pre-set!You must obey the pre-established standards just to get by.Kids are constantly stressed and worried to satisfy the “test-gods” instead of helping them thrive on their God given talents.Kids and teenagers are at a critical developing stage in life.Their grades is what the world is telling them who they are in the world.Do good — Kids are being told they are super-human. - (False!)Do bad — Kids are being told they’re losers and “worthless.” (Also false!)This fear-based system also affect kids social groups.You either belong to the top-class.Or you belong to the “low-class” demotivated losers! You tell me… ARE THEY HAVING ANY FUN?

Not being late to school=Getting to work on time. Working for As on schoolwork=Doing your job and doing it well enough. Relations with peers and friends=Workplace interaction. But all in all, because education is a fabric of a flourishing society. Dumb people do dumb things and make dumb decisions that can effect multiple people.
